apiClassifier.shortdesc: Manages a user's server-side instant messaging roster (or "buddy list").

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Manages a user's server-side instant messaging roster (or "buddy list"). By default, this class uses an internal data provider to keep track of roster data locally and provides a "read-only" form of the Data Provider API for external use. Non-read operations are performed using alternative, roster-specific methods.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Broadcast whenever a contact in the roster becomes available.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Broadcast whenever a contact in the roster becomes available. (Goes from offline to online.) The event object contains an attribute jid with the JID of the user who became available.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Broadcast whenever a contact in the roster becomes unavailable.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Broadcast whenever a contact in the roster becomes unavailable. (Goes from online to offline.) The event object contains an attribute jid with the JID of the user who became unavailable.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Broadcast whenever a subscription request that you make (via the addContact() or requestSubscription() methods) is denied.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Broadcast whenever a subscription request that you make (via the addContact() or requestSubscription() methods) is denied. The event object contains an attribute jid with the JID of the user who denied the request.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Broadcast whenever someone requests to subscribe to your presence.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Broadcast whenever someone requests to subscribe to your presence. The event object contains an attribute jid with the JID of the user who is requesting a presence subscription.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Broadcast whenever someone revokes your presence subscription.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Broadcast whenever someone revokes your presence subscription. This is not an event that is fired when you revoke a subscription, but rather when one of your contacts decides that he/she/it no longer wants you to know about their presence status. The event object contains an attribute jid with the JID of the user who revoked your subscription.

apiParam.apiDesc: A reference to an XMPPConnection class instance

apiOperation.shortdesc: Adds a contact to the roster.

apiParam.apiDesc: The JID of the contact to add
A friendly name for use when displaying this contact in the roster
(Optional) The name of the group that this contact should be added to. (Used for organization in the roster listing.

(Optional) Determines whether a subscription request should be sent to this user. Most of the time you will want this parameter to be true. You will be unable to view the contacts presence status until a subscription request is granted.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Adds a contact to the roster. Remember: All roster data is managed on the server-side, so this contact is added to the server-side roster first, and upon successful addition, reflected in the local client-side copy of the roster.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Revokes an existing presence subscription or denies a subscription request.

apiParam.apiDesc: The JID of the user or service that you are denying subscription

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Revokes an existing presence subscription or denies a subscription request. If a user has sent you a subscription request you can use this method to deny that request. Otherwise, if a user already has a granted presence subscription, you can use this method to revoke that subscription.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Fetches the roster data from the server.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Fetches the roster data from the server. Once the data has been fetched, the Roster's data provider is populated appropriately. If the Roster-XMPPConnection class dependency has been set up before logging in, then this method will be called automatically because the Roster listens for "login" events from the XMPPConnection.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Get a group by given name

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Get a group by given name

apiOperation.shortdesc: Get the Presence of the given user if any.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Get the Presence of the given user if any.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Grants a user or service authorization for subscribing to your presence.

apiParam.apiDesc: The JID of the user or service to grant subscription to
Whether or not a reciprocal subscription request should be sent to the grantee, so that you may, in turn, subscribe to his/her/its presence.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Grants a user or service authorization for subscribing to your presence. Once authorization is granted, the user can see whether you are offline, online, away, etc. Subscriptions can be revoked at any time using the denySubscription() method.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Removes a contact from the roster and revokes all presence subscriptions for that contact.

apiParam.apiDesc: The value object which is to be removed

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Removes a contact from the roster and revokes all presence subscriptions for that contact. This method will only attempt action if the contact you are trying to remove is currently on the roster in the first place.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Requests subscription authorization with a user or service.

apiParam.apiDesc: The JID of the user or service that you wish to subscribe to

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Requests subscription authorization with a user or service. In the XMPP-world, you cannot receive notifications on changes to a contact's presence until that contact has authorized you to subscribe to his/her/its presence.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Sets your current presence status.

apiParam.apiDesc: The show type for your presence. This represents what others should see - whether you are offline, online, away, etc.
The status message associated with the show value
(Optional) A priority integer for the presence

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Sets your current presence status. Calling this method notifies others who are subscribed to your presence of a presence change. You should use this to change your status to away, extended-away, etc. There are static variables that you can use defined in the presence class for the show parameter:
Presence.SHOW_AWAY
Presence.SHOW_CHAT
Presence.SHOW_DND
Presence.SHOW_NORMAL
Presence.SHOW_XA

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
Photograph.
The image height and width SHOULD be between thirty-two (32) and ninety-six (96) pixels; the recommended size is sixty-four (64) pixels high and sixty-four (64) pixels wide.
The image SHOULD be square.

apiConstructor.shortdesc: To save a photo, either binaryValue or externalValue are required, but not both.

apiParam.apiDesc: The image type of the photo. Required if binaryValue is passed in.
The BASE64 encoded binary value of the photo. Either binaryValue or externalValue are required, but not both.
The URI to an external photo. Either binaryValue or externalValue are required, but not both.

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc: To save a photo, either binaryValue or externalValue are required, but not both. If binaryValue is passed in, type is required. If externalValue is passed in, type is not required.

apiValue.shortdesc: Base64 encoded data.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Base64 encoded data. The image SHOULD use less than eight kilobytes (8k) of data; this restriction is to be enforced by the publishing client.
The image data MUST conform to the base64Binary datatype [7] and thus be encoded in accordance with Section 6.8 of RFC 2045 [8], which recommends that base64 data should have lines limited to at most 76 characters in length. However, any whitespace characters (e.g., '\\r' and '\\n') MUST be ignored.

Mimetype of the given bytes value, if any. Should be set by hand.
The image content type [6] SHOULD be image/gif, image/jpeg, or image/png; support for the "image/png" content type is REQUIRED, support for the "image/gif" and "image/jpeg" content types is RECOMMENDED, and support for any other content type is OPTIONAL.
